data.question: What is the publication year of the article?
What type of clusters were used in the templated synthesis of II−VI covalent superlattices?
What is the role of metal-chelate dyes in the synthesis process?
data.answer: They serve as templates and tune the optical properties of the resulting dye semiconductor composite materials.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of COV-10 and COV-11 represents the first time II−VI clusters with 32 Cd2+ sites have been assembled into covalent superlattices.
What is the temperature range used for the solvothermal synthesis conditions?
What distinguishes COV-10 and COV-11 from previous frameworks?
data.answer: They consist of corner-sharing [Cd32S14(SC6H5)38]2- clusters and adopt a 2-fold interpenetrating diamond-type lattice.

data.question: True or False: Metal-chelate dyes have a higher charge density compared to the clusters used in the synthesis.
What is the main advantage of using metal-chelate dyes over conventional templating methods?
data.answer: Metal-chelate dyes have larger size and lower charge density, making them ideal for templating the formation of superlattices made of low-charge density clusters.

data.question: True or False: The structural diversity of metal-chelate dyes allows for the assembly of different low-charged nanoclusters into open topologies.
What is the significance of the hydrophobic surface of metal-chelate dyes in the synthesis process?
data.answer: It matches well with the hydrophobic surface of the nanoclusters, facilitating the assembly.

data.question: True or False: MOL-6CdS-FePAL was synthesized at a higher temperature than COV-10CdS-FePAL.
What unique feature does each Cd-32 cluster in MOL-6 and MOL-7 have?
data.answer: One of four barrelanoid cages is rotated by 60°.

data.question: True or False: The composite materials synthesized exhibit significant visible light absorption that varies with the nature of the metal-chelate dyes.
What potential applications do the synthesized chalcogenide open frameworks have?
data.answer: They might be useful as visible light photocatalysts or photocurrent generators.

data.question: True or False: The resulting chalcogenide open frameworks do not exhibit interesting optical properties.
What makes metal-chelate dyes effective structure-directing agents in this synthesis?
data.answer: Their ability to control the organization of relatively low-charged chalcogenide nanoclusters into open frameworks.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of COV-10 and COV-11 did not involve the use of metal-chelate dyes.
What is the source of Cd2+ and SPh- in the synthesis?
What is the role of thiourea in the synthesis process?
data.answer: It is used as the S2- source.

data.question: What solvents are used in the synthesis of the materials?
data.answer: CH3CN or a mixture of CH3CN and H2O in various ratios.
